Some prokaryotic names without standing in nomenclature

Number of names cited in this file: 938

 

Introduction

A frequently asked question is "why a name in current use does not appear in the List of Prokaryotic names with Standing in Nomenclature?"
Of course, it is possible that I have made an error or an omission. However, more often, the name is not included because it has no standing in nomenclature.

The Bacteriological Code (1990 Revision), together with changes approved and published by the International Committee on Systematics of Prokaryotes (see Alterations to the Bacteriological Code), is the cornerstone of prokaryotic nomenclature. It states that the name of a new taxon, or a new combination for an existing taxon, is validly published if one of the following criteria is met.

1) The name is cited in the Approved Lists of Bacterial Names.

The Approved Lists of Bacterial Names contain all the prokaryotic names having standing in nomenclature on 1 January 1980 and they set a new starting point in prokaryotic nomenclature [Rule 24a]. When bacteriologists agreed to make a new start in prokaryotic nomenclature, they were faced with tens of thousands of names in the literature of the past. Except 2,336 names, it was impossible to tell exactly what prokaryotes they referred to. These 2,336 were therefore retained in the Approved Lists. See: Sneath and Brenner: "Official" nomenclature lists. ASM News, 1992, 58, 175 (available on the Internet).

2) The name is published in papers in the International Journal of Systematic Bacteriology (IJSB) or in the International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology (IJSEM) and conforms to requirements laid down in the Bacteriological Code.

3) The name is validly published by announcement in a validation list.

Validation Lists are lists published in the IJSB/IJSEM, serving as a mechanism for validly publishing prokaryotic names which have been effectively*, but not validly published.
Announcement in a Validation List is primarily the responsibility of the author(s) of the new names or new combinations. However, other individuals may also submit a new name or new combination for valid publication, provided it conforms to the rules of the code. Scientists wishing to have new names and/or combinations included in a list should send the pertinent reprint or a photocopy or a PDF file thereof to the IJSEM Editorial Office**. Citation in a Validation List is not automatic! Papers will be reviewed by a IJSEM Editor and by the Lists Editor.

Starting in August 2002, it is also a requirement of the IJSEM and the ICSP (International Committee on Systematics of Prokaryotes) that authors of new species, new subspecies and new combinations provide evidence that types are deposited in at least two recognized culture collections in two different countries.
On 29 July 2002, the Judicial Commission confirmed this decision, although rare exceptions can be accepted in those cases where maintenance conditions for the culture are so exceptional (e.g. obligate barophilies or extremely virulent pathogens) that not more than one culture collection can be found which is able to maintain the strain.

For more information, see:
1 EUZÉBY (J.P.) and TINDALL (B.J.): Valid publications of new names or new combinations: making use of the Validation Lists. ASM News, 2004, 70, 258-259. Available on the Internet.
2 TINDALL (B.J.), KÄMPFER (P.), EUZÉBY (J.P.) and OREN (A.): Valid publication of names of prokaryotes according to the rules of nomenclature: past history and current practice. Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol., 2006, 56, 2715-2720.
Original article in IJSEM Online

The names cited below are either not effectively published or effectively but not validly published.

Warning

  • The numerous names (more than 22,000!) published before the 1 January 1980 and not included in the Approved Lists are not listed below.
  • Names cited in the file IJSEM: Papers in Press, are not listed below.
  • This list is not exhaustive.
  • Some names listed below might be in the process of being validly published.

      

     

    "Abiotrophiapara-adiacens" Kanamoto et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: KANAMOTO (T.), SATO (S.) and INOUE (M.): Genetic heterogeneities and phenotypic characteristics of strains of the genus Abiotrophia and proposal of Abiotrophia para-adiacens sp. nov. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2000, 38, 492-498. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acetobacter carbinolicum subsp. kysingense" Paarup et al., subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain SyrA5 = DSM 16427 = ATCC BAA-990.
    Reference: PAARUP (M.)., FRIEDRICH (M.W.), TINDALL (B.J.) and FINSTER (K.): Characterization of the psychrotolerant acetogen strain SyrA5 and the emended description of the species Acetobacterium carbinolicum. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2006, 89, 55-69. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acetobacter xylinum subsp. nonacetoxidans" Kojima et al., subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain BPR 2002 = JCM 10150.
    Reference: KOJIMA (Y.), TONOUCHI (N.), TSUCHIDA (T.), YOSHINAGA (F.) and YAMADA (Y.): The characterization of acetic acid bacteria efficiently producing bacterial cellulose from sucrose: The proposal of Acetobacter xylinum subsp. nonacetoxidans subsp. nov. Bioscience Biotechnology and Biochemistry, 1998, 62, 185-187.

      

    "Acetobacterium psammolithicum" Krumholz et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain CN-E = SMCC/W 751.
    Reference: KRUMHOLZ (L.R.), HARRIS (S.H.), TAY (S.T.) and SUFLITA (J.M.): Characterization of two subsurface H2-utilizing bacteria, Desulfomicrobium hypogeium sp. nov. and Acetobacterium psammolithicum sp. nov., and their ecological roles. Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 1999, 65, 2300-2306. Effective publication Online

      

    "Achromobacter cobalamini" Shteinberg et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: SHTEINBERG (B.I.), GEBGARDT (A.G.) and DATSIUK (N.M.): Possible reason for growth inhibition of Achromobacter cobalamini sp. nov. growing on molasses medi (in Russian). Mikrobiol. Zh.,1982, 44, 18-22.

      

    "Acidimethylosilex" Pol et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Acidimethylosilex fumarolicum" Pol et al.
    Reference: POL (A.), HEIJMANS (K.), HARHANGI (H.R.), TEDESCO (D.), JETTEN (M.S.M.) and OP DEN CAMP (H.J.M.): Methanotrophy below pH 1 by a new Verrucomicrobia species. Nature, 2007, 450, 874-878. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidianus manzaensis" Yoshida et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain NA-1 = NBRC 100595 = ATCC BAA 1057.
    Reference: YOSHIDA (N.), NAKASATO (M.), OHMURA (N.), ANDO (A.), SAIKI (H.), ISHII (M.) and IGARASHI (Y.): Acidianus manzaensis sp. nov., a novel thermoacidophilic archaeon growing autotrophically by the oxidation of H2 with the reduction of Fe3+. Current Microbiol, 2006, 53, 406-411. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidianus tengchongenses" He et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain S5.
    Reference: HE (Z.), LI (Y.) and ZHOU (P.): Study on reclassification of extremely thermoacidophilic archaea strain S5. (in Chinese). Wei Sheng Wu Xue Bao, 2001, 41, 259-264.

      

    "Acidianus tengchongensis" He et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain S5.
    Reference: HE (Z.G.), ZHONG (H.) and LI (Y.): Acidianus tengchongensis sp. nov., a new species of acidothermophilic archaeon isolated from an acidothermal spring. Curr. Microbiol., 2004, 48, 159-163. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidilobus sulfurireducens" Boyd et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain 18D70.
    Reference: BOYD (E.S.), JACKSON (R.A.), ENCARNACION (G.), ZAHN (J.A.), BEARD (T.), LEAVITT (W.D.), PI (Y.), ZHANG (C.L.), PEARSON (A.), D'IMPERIO (S.), McDERMOTT (T.R.) and GEESEY (G.G.): Isolation, characterization, and ecology of sulfur-respiring Crenarchaea inhabiting acid-sulfate-chloride geothermal springs in Yellowstone National Park. Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 2007, 73, 6669-6677. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidimethylosilex fumarolicum" Pol et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: no type strain designated.
    Reference: POL (A.), HEIJMANS (K.), HARHANGI (H.R.), TEDESCO (D.), JETTEN (M.S.M.) and OP DEN CAMP (H.J.M.): Methanotrophy below pH 1 by a new Verrucomicrobia species. Nature, 2007, 450, 874-878. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidipila" Okamura et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Acidipila rosea" Okamura et al.
    Reference: OKAMURA (K.), KAWAI (A.), YAMADA (T.) and HIRAISHI (A.): Acidipila rosea gen. nov., sp. nov., an acidophilic chemoorganotrophic bacterium belonging to the phylum Acidobacteria. FEMS Microbiol. Lett., 2011, 317, 138-142. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidipila rosea" Okamura et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain AP8 = NBRC 107607 = KCTC 23427.
    Reference: OKAMURA (K.), KAWAI (A.), YAMADA (T.) and HIRAISHI (A.): Acidipila rosea gen. nov., sp. nov., an acidophilic chemoorganotrophic bacterium belonging to the phylum Acidobacteria. FEMS Microbiol. Lett., 2011, 317, 138-142. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acidovorax psychrofacilis" Vasil'eva et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain Z-0064.
    Reference: VASIL'EVA (L.V.), SAVEL'EVA (N.D.), OMEL'CHENKO (M.V.), LYSENKO (A.M.), PUSHEVA (M.A.), TROTSENKO (Y.A.) and ZAVARZIN (G.A.): Arthrobacter crygenae sp. nov. and Acidovorax psychrofacilis sp. nov., psychrophilic hydrogen bacteria from tundra soil. Microbiologiya, 1998, 67, 195-200 [English language translation].

      

    "Acinetobacter antiviralis" Lee et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain KNF2022 = KCTC 0699BP.
    Reference: LEE (J.S.), LEE (K.C.), KIM (K.K.), HWANG (I.C.), JANG (C.), KIM (N.G.), YEO (W.H.), KIM (B.S.), YU (Y.M.) and AHN (J.S.): Acinetobacter antiviralis sp. nov., from tobacco plant roots. J. Microbiol. Biotechnol., 2009, 19, 250-256. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acinetobacter kyonggiensis" Lee and Lee, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain KSL5401-037 = JCM 17071 = KEMC 5401-037.
    Reference: LEE (H.J.) and LEE (S.S.): Acinetobacter kyonggiensis sp. nov., a β-glucosidase-producing bacterium, isolated from sewage treatment plant. J. Microbiol., 2010, 48, 754-759. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acinetobacter marinus" Yoon et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain SW-3 = KCTC 12259 = DSM 16312.
    Reference: YOON (J.H.), KIM (I.G.), OH (T.K.): Acinetobacter marinus sp. nov. and Acinetobacter seohaensis sp. nov., isolated from sea water of the Yellow Sea in Korea. J. Microbiol. Biotechnol., 2007, 17, 1743-1750. Effective publication Online (PDF)

    Reference: CHAUDHARY (H.J.), PENG (G.), HU (M.), HE (Y.), YANG (L.), LUO (Y.) and TAN (Z.): Genetic diversity of endophytic diazotrophs of the wild rice, Oryza alta and identification of the new diazotroph, Acinetobacter oryzae sp. nov. Microb. Ecol., 2012, 63, 813-821. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acinetobacter seohaensis" Yoon et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain SW-100 = KCTC 12260 = DSM 16313.
    Reference: YOON (J.H.), KIM (I.G.), OH (T.K.): Acinetobacter marinus sp. nov. and Acinetobacter seohaensis sp. nov., isolated from sea water of the Yellow Sea in Korea. J. Microbiol. Biotechnol., 2007, 17, 1743-1750. Effective publication Online (PDF)

      

    "Acinetobacter septicus" Kilic et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain AK001.
    Reference: KILIC (A.), LI (H.), MELLMANN (A.), BASUSTAOGLU (A.C.), KUL (M.), SENSES (Z.), AYDOGAN (H.), STRATTON (C.W.), HARMSEN (D.) et TANG (Y.W.): Acinetobacter septicus sp. nov, associated with a nosocomial outbreak of bacteremia in a neonatal intensive care unit. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2008, 46, 902-908. Effective publication Online

      

    "Acinetobacter venetianus" Di Cello et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: DI CELLO (F.), PEPI (M.), BALDI (F.) and FANI (R.): Molecular characterization on an n-alkane-degrading bacterial community and identification of a new species, Acinetobacter venetianus. Res. Microbiol., 1997, 148, 237-249.
    Note: "Acinetobacter venetianus" Di Cello et al. 1997 is now known as ¤ Acinetobacter venetianus Vaneechoutte et al. 2009 ex Di Cello et al. 1997.

      

    "Actimicrobium" Kim et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Actimicrobium antarcticum" Kim et al.
    Reference: KIM (E.H.), JEONG (H.J.), LEE (Y.K.), MOON (E.Y.), CHO (J.C.), LEE (H.K.) and HONG (S.G.): Actimicrobium antarcticum gen. nov., sp. nov., of the family Oxalobacteraceae, isolated from Antarctic coastal seawater. Curr. Microbiol., 2011, 63, 213-217. Effective publication Online

      

    "Actimicrobium antarcticum" Kim et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain KOPRI 25157 = JCM 16673 = KCTC 23040.
    Reference: KIM (E.H.), JEONG (H.J.), LEE (Y.K.), MOON (E.Y.), CHO (J.C.), LEE (H.K.) and HONG (S.G.): Actimicrobium antarcticum gen. nov., sp. nov., of the family Oxalobacteraceae, isolated from Antarctic coastal seawater.     "Actinomadura routienii" Huang, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: CULLEN (W.P.), CELMER (W.D.), CHAPPEL (L.R.), HUANG (L.H.), MAEDA (H.), NISHIYAMA (S.), SHIBAKAWA (R.), TONE (J.) and WATTS (P.C.): CP-54,883 a novel chlorine-containing polyether antibiotic produced by a new species of Actinomadura: taxonomy of the producing culture, fermentation, physico-chemical and biological properties of the antibiotic.     "Actinomadura spinosa" Saitoh et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain AA0851.
    Reference: SAITOH (K.), TENMYO (O.), YAMAMOTO (S.), FURUMAI (T.) and OKI (T.): Pradimicin S, a new pradimicin analog. I. Taxonomy, fermentation and biological activities. J. Antibiot. (Tokyo), 1993, 46, 580-588.

      

    "Actinomyces houstonensis" Clarridge III and Zhang, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain Houston VAMC strain 3971.
    Reference: CLARRIDGE III (J.E.) and ZHANG (Q.): Genotypic diversity of clinical Actinomyces species: phenotype, source, and disease correlation among genospecies. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2002, 40, 3442-3448. Effective publication Online

      

    "Actinoplanes arizonaensis" Karwowski et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain AB660D-122.
    Reference: KARWOWSKI (J.P.), JACKSON (M.), THERIAULT (R.J.), PROKOP (J.F.), MAUS (M.L.), HANSEN (C.F.) and HENSEY (D.M.): Arizonins, a new complex of antibiotics related to kalafungin. I. Taxonomy of the producing culture, fermentation and biological activity. J. Antibiot. (Tokyo), 1988, 41, 1205-1211.

    Proposed type strain: strain 41042.

I. Taxonomy of producing organism and fermentation. J. Antibiot. (Tokyo), 1983, 36, 957-960.

Merr). Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2013, 103, 293-298. Effective publication Online

    "Aegyptianella botuliformis" Huchzermeyer et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: not cultivated. Giemsa stained slides of guineafowl blood infected with Aegyptianelle botuliformis have been deposited in the blood parasite collection of the Protozoology Section of the Veterinary Research Institute, Onderstepoort, Republic of South Africa (No. 6145-6154).
    Reference: HUCHZERMEYER (F.W.), HORAK (I.G.), PUTTERILL (J.F.) and EARLÉ (R.A.): Description of Aegyptianella botuliformis n. sp. (Rickettsiales: Anaplasmataceae) from the helmeted guineafowl, Numida meleagris. Onderstepoort J. Vet. Res., 1992, 59, 97-101.

      

    "Aegyptianella minutus" Peirce, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: not cultivated. Hapantotype slide: IRCAH: 4215 from Alicippe peracensis coll. McClure 6 April 1959, deposited in the IRCAH, Queensland Museum, Brisbane, Australia.
    Reference: PEIRCE (M.A.): A new species of Aegyptianella from south-east Asia. Vet. Rec., 1999, 145, 288.

      

    "Aegyptianella ranarum" Desser, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: not cultivated.
    Reference: DESSER (S.S.): Aegyptianella ranarum sp. n. (Rickettsiales, Anaplasmataceae): ultrastructure and prevalence in frogs from Ontario. J. Wildl. Dis., 1987, 23, 52-59.
    Note: In 2004, Zhang and Rikihisa proposed to transfer "Aegyptianella ranarum" Desser 1987 to the family ¤ Flavobacteriaceae as ¤ "Candidatus Hemobacterium ranarum" Zhang and Rikihisa 2004.

      

    "Aeromicrobium massiliense" Ramasamy et al., sp. nov.

    "Aeromonas cavernicola" Martínez-Murcia et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain CCM7641 = DSM24474 = CECT7862.
    Reference: MARTÍNEZ-MURCIA (A.), BEAZ-HIDALGO (R.), SVEC (P.), SAAVEDRA (M.J.), FIGUERAS (M.J.) and SEDLACEK (I.): Aeromonas cavernicola sp. nov., isolated from fresh water of a brook in a cavern. Curr. Microbiol., 2013, 66, 197-204. Effective publication Online

      

    "Aeromonas dhakensis" Beaz-Hidalgo et al., comb. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain P21 = LMG 19562 = CCUG 45377.
    Basonym: Aeromonas hydrophila subsp. dhakensis Huys et al. 2002
    Reference: BEAZ-HIDALGO (R.), MARTÍNEZ-MURCIA (A.) and FIGUERAS (M.J.): Reclassification of Aeromonas hydrophila subsp. dhakensis Huys et al. 2002 and Aeromonas aquariorum Martínez-Murcia et al. 2008 as Aeromonas dhakensis sp. nov. comb nov. and emendation of the species Aeromonas hydrophila. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2013, 36, 171-176. Effective publication Online

      

    "Aestuariihabitans" Yoon et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Aestuariihabitans beolgyonensis" Yoon et al.
    Reference: YOON (J.H.), PARK (S.) and JUNG (Y.T.): Aestuariihabitans beolgyonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel alphaproteobacterium isolated from tidal flat sediment. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, published online: June 01, 2013 (doi: 10.1007/s10482-013-9940-2). Effective publication Online

      

    "Aestuariihabitans beolgyonensis" Yoon et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain BB-MW15 = KCTC 32324 = CCUG 63829.
    Reference: YOON (J.H.), PARK (S.) and JUNG (Y.T.): Aestuariihabitans beolgyonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel alphaproteobacterium isolated from tidal flat sediment. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, published online: June 01, 2013 (doi: 10.1007/s10482-013-9940-2). Effective publication Online

      

    "Agrobacterium fabrum" Lassalle et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain C58.

    Reference: JUNG (M.Y.), PAEK (W.K.), PARK (I.S.), HAN (J.R.), SIN (Y.), PAEK (J.), RHEE (M.S.), KIM (H.), SONG (H.S.) and CHANG (Y.H.): Bacillus gaemokensis sp. nov., isolated from foreshore tidal flat sediment from the Yellow Sea.     Notes:
    1 Byssophaga Reichenbach is illegitimate because of precedence of the zoological genus Byssophaga Stretch 1872, Arctiidae, Lepidoptera.
    2 Byssophaga Reichenbach is now known as ¤ Byssovorax Reichenbach 2006.

    "Campylobacter troglodytis" Kaur et al., sp. nov.

    Proposed type strain: strain 513/05 = DSM 18396 = JCM 16470 = LMG 23732.
    Basonym: Enterobacter helveticus Stephan et al. 2007.
    Reference: BRADY (C.), CLEENWERCK (I.), VENTER (S.), COUTINHO (T.) and DE VOS (P.): Taxonomic evaluation of the genus Enterobacter based on multilocus sequence analysis (MLSA): Proposal to reclassify E. nimipressuralis and E. amnigenus into Lelliottia gen. nov. as Lelliottia nimipressuralis comb. nov. and Lelliottia amnigena comb. nov., respectively, E. gergoviae and E. pyrinus into Pluralibacter gen. nov. as Pluralibacter gergoviae comb. nov. and Pluralibacter pyrinus comb. nov., respectively, E. cowanii, E. radicincitans, E. oryzae and E. arachidis into Kosakonia gen. nov. as Kosakonia cowanii comb. nov., Kosakonia radicincitans comb. nov., Kosakonia oryzae comb. nov. and Kosakonia arachidis comb. nov., respectively, and E. turicensis, E. helveticus and E. pulveris into Cronobacter as Cronobacter zurichensis nom. nov., Cronobacter helveticus comb. nov. and Cronobacter pulveris comb. nov., respectively, and emended description of the genera Enterobacter and Cronobacter. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., published online: April 27, 2013 (doi: 10.1016/j.syapm.2013.03.005). Effective publication Online

      

    "Cronobacter muytjensii" Iversen et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain ATCC 51329= CIP 103581.
    Reference: IVERSEN (C.), LEHNER (A.), MULLANE (N.), BIDLAS (E.), CLEENWERCK (I.), MARUGG (J.), FANNING (S.), STEPHAN (R.) and JOOSTEN (H.): The taxonomy of Enterobacter sakazakii: proposal of a new genus Cronobacter gen. nov. and descriptions of Cronobacter sakazakii comb. nov. Cronobacter sakazakii subsp. sakazakii, comb. nov., Cronobacter sakazakii subsp. malonaticus subsp. nov., Cronobacter turicensis sp. nov., Cronobacter muytjensii sp. nov., Cronobacter dublinensis sp. nov. and Cronobacter genomospecies 1. BMC Evolutionary Biology 2007, 7:64. Effective publication Online
    Note: "Cronobacter muytjensii" Iversen et al. 2007 is now known as ¤ Cronobacter muytjensii Iversen et al. 2008.

      

    "Cronobacter pulveris" (Stephan et al. 2008) Brady et al., comb. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain 601/05 = DSM 19144 = JCM 16471 = LMG 24057.
    Basonym: Enterobacter pulveris Stephan et al. 2008.
    Reference: BRADY (C.), CLEENWERCK (I.), VENTER (S.), COUTINHO (T.) and DE VOS (P.): Taxonomic evaluation of the genus Enterobacter based on multilocus sequence analysis (MLSA): Proposal to reclassify E. nimipressuralis and E. amnigenus into Lelliottia gen. nov. as Lelliottia nimipressuralis comb. nov. and Lelliottia amnigena comb. nov., respectively, E. gergoviae and E. pyrinus into Pluralibacter gen. nov. as Pluralibacter gergoviae comb. nov. and Pluralibacter pyrinus comb. nov., respectively, E. cowanii, E. radicincitans, E. oryzae and E. arachidis into Kosakonia gen. nov. as Kosakonia cowanii comb. nov., Kosakonia radicincitans comb. nov., Kosakonia oryzae comb. nov. and Kosakonia arachidis comb. nov., respectively, and E. turicensis, E. helveticus and E. pulveris into Cronobacter as Cronobacter zurichensis nom. nov., Cronobacter helveticus comb. nov. and Cronobacter pulveris comb. nov., respectively, and emended description of the genera Enterobacter and Cronobacter. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., published online: April 27, 2013 (doi: 10.1016/j.syapm.2013.03.005). Effective publication Online

    "Gluconobacter morbifer" Roh et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain G707 = KCTC 22116 = JCM 15512.
    Reference: ROH (S.W.), NAM (Y.D.), CHANG (H.W.), KIM (K.H.), KIM (M.S.), RYU (J.H.), KIM (S.H.), LEE (W.J.) and BAE (J.W.): Phylogenetic characterization of two novel commensal bacteria related to innate immune homeostasis in Drosophila. Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 2008, 74, 6171-6177. Effective publication Online

      

    "Gordonia jacobaea" De Miguel et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain MV-1.
    Reference: DE MIGUEL (T.), SIEIRO (C.), POZA (M.) and VILLA (T.G.): Isolation and taxonomic study of a new canthaxanthin-containing bacterium, Gordonia jacobaea MV-1 sp. nov. Int. Microbiol., 2000, 3, 107-111.

    "Helicobacter heilmannii" Solnick et al., sp. nov.

    Notes:

  • Strains of "Helicobacter heilmannii" type one gastrospirilla are now described as ¤ "Candidatus Helicobacter suis".
  • Strains of "Helicobacter heilmannii" type two gastrospirilla are now known as ¤ "Candidatus Helicobacter heilmannii".

    Proposed type species: "Jahnia thaxteri" (ex Jahn 1924) Reichenbach.
    Reference: REICHENBACH (H.): Genus V. Jahnia gen. nov. In: D.J. BRENNER, N.R. KRIEG, J.T. STALEY and G. M. GARRITY (editors), Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology, second edition, vol. 2 (The Proteobacteria), part C (The Alpha-, Beta-, Delta-, and Epsilonproteobacteria), Springer, New York, 2005, pp. 1130-1131.
    Note: "Jahnia" is now known as ¤ Jahnella corrig. Reichenbach 2007.

    Proposed type strain: strain Pl t4 = DSM 14626 = JCM 12631.
    Synonym: "Archangium thaxteri" Jahn 1924.
    Reference: REICHENBACH (H.): Genus V. Jahnia gen. nov. In: D.J. BRENNER, N.R. KRIEG, J.T. STALEY and G. M.     Proposed type species: "Kosakonia cowanii" (Inoue et al. 2001) Brady et al.
    Reference: BRADY (C.), CLEENWERCK (I.), VENTER (S.), COUTINHO (T.) and DE VOS (P.): Taxonomic evaluation of the genus Enterobacter based on multilocus sequence analysis (MLSA): Proposal to reclassify E. nimipressuralis and E. amnigenus into Lelliottia gen. nov. as Lelliottia nimipressuralis comb. nov. and Lelliottia amnigena comb. nov., respectively, E. gergoviae and E. pyrinus into Pluralibacter gen. nov. as Pluralibacter gergoviae comb. nov. and Pluralibacter pyrinus comb. nov., respectively, E. cowanii, E. radicincitans, E. oryzae and E. arachidis into Kosakonia gen. nov. as Kosakonia cowanii comb. nov., Kosakonia radicincitans comb. nov., Kosakonia oryzae comb. nov. and Kosakonia arachidis comb. nov., respectively, and E. turicensis, E. helveticus and E. pulveris into Cronobacter as Cronobacter zurichensis nom. nov., Cronobacter helveticus comb. nov. and Cronobacter pulveris comb. nov., respectively, and emended description of the genera Enterobacter and Cronobacter. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., published online: April 27, 2013 (doi: 10.1016/j.syapm.2013.03.005). Effective publication Online

    Proposed type strain: strain 001.
    Reference: KONSTANTINOV (S.R.), SMIDT (H.) and DE VOS (W.M.): Representational difference analysis and real-time PCR for strain-specific quantification of Lactobacillus sobrius sp. nov. Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 2005, 71, 7578-7581.

      

    "Lelliottia" Brady et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Lelliottia nimipressuralis" (Carter 1945) Brady et al.
    Reference: BRADY (C.), CLEENWERCK (I.), VENTER (S.), COUTINHO (T.) and DE VOS (P.): Taxonomic evaluation of the genus Enterobacter based on multilocus sequence analysis (MLSA): Proposal to reclassify E. nimipressuralis and E. amnigenus into Lelliottia gen. nov. as Lelliottia nimipressuralis comb. nov. and Lelliottia amnigena comb. nov., respectively, E. gergoviae and E. pyrinus into Pluralibacter gen. nov. as Pluralibacter gergoviae comb. nov. and Pluralibacter pyrinus comb. nov., respectively, E. cowanii, E. radicincitans, E. oryzae and E. arachidis into Kosakonia gen. nov. as Kosakonia cowanii comb. nov., Kosakonia radicincitans comb. nov., Kosakonia oryzae comb. nov. and Kosakonia arachidis comb. nov., respectively, and E. turicensis, E. helveticus and E. pulveris into Cronobacter as Cronobacter zurichensis nom. nov., Cronobacter helveticus comb. nov. and Cronobacter pulveris comb. nov., respectively, and emended description of the genera Enterobacter and Cronobacter. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., published online: April 27, 2013 (doi: 10.1016/j.syapm.2013.03.005). Effective publication Online

    Proposed type strain: strain NS23 = NBRC 106595 = BCC 40155.
    Reference: NOISANGIAM (R.), NUNTAGIJ (A.), PONGSILP (N.), BOONKERD (N.), DENDUANGBORIPANT (J.), RONSON (C.) and TEAUMROONG (N.): Heavy metal tolerant Metalliresistens boonkerdii gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus in the family Bradyrhizobiaceae isolated from soil in Thailand. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2010, 33, 374-382. Effective publication Online
    → ¤ Rhodopseudomonas boonkerdii Noisangiam et al., sp. nov.
    Note: In the original conclusion, Noisangiam et al. proposed the isolated strain NS23 as a new genus in the family Bradyrhizobiaceae due to the use of the wrong sequence of the 16S rRNA gene (AB498818) of the type strain. After the use of the correct sequence (D25312), strain NS23 did not fall outside the genus Rhodopseudomonas. Therefore, this change alters the original conclusion: strain NS23 is not a new genus but a new species of Rhodopseudomonas. Among all species of Rhodopseudomonas, strain NS23 most closely resembled Rhodopseudomonas palustris, Rhodopseudomonas rhenobacensis and Rhodopseudomonas faecalis at a similar level of 97–98%. However, substantial physiological differences existed between strain NS23 and these three species of Rhodopseudomonas. Differentiation of strain NS23 from other taxa was confirmed by data of the cellular fatty acid content and also by multilocus sequence analysis, showing that strain NS23 fell into a single major cluster distinguished from the other compared species. Therefore, Noisangiam et al. propose strain NS23 as a new species of the genus Rhodopseudomonas, with the name Rhodopseudomonas boonkerdii.
    Reference: NOISANGIAM (R.), NUNTAGIJ (A.), PONGSILP (N.), BOONKERD (N.), DENDUANGBORIPANT (J.), RONSON (C.) and TEAUMROONG (N.): Erratum to "Heavy metal tolerant Metalliresistens boonkerdii gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus in the family Bradyrhizobiaceae isolated from soil in Thailand" [Syst. Appl. Microbiol. 33 (2010) 374–382]. Proposal of Rhodopseudomonas boonkerdii sp. nov., a new heavy metal tolerant bacterium isolated from Thailand. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2011, 34, 166-168. Effective publication Online

    Proposed type strain: strain Px1.
    Reference: SUN (Z.), ZHOU (Y.) and DONG (X.): Characterization and phylogenetics of a new species of genus Methanobacterium (in Chinese). Wei Sheng Wu Xue Bao, 2001, 41, 265-269.

    "Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. massiliense" (Adékambi et al. 2006) Leao et al., comb. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain CCUG 48898 = CIP 108297 = JCM 15300.
    Basonym: Mycobacterium massiliense Adékambi et al. 2006
    Reference: LEAO (S.C.), TORTOLI (E.), VIANA-NIERO (C.), UEKI (SY.M.), BATISTA LIMA (KV.), LOPES (M.L.), YUBERO (J.), MENENDEZ (M.C.) and GARCIA (M.J.): Characterization of Mycobacteria from a major Brazilian Outbreak suggests that revision of the taxonomic status of members of the Mycobacterium chelonae-M. abscessus group is needed. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2009 47, 2691-2698. Effective publication Online
    Note: In 2009, Leao et al. proposed the union of Mycobacterium bolletii and Mycobacterium massiliense, and the recognition of two subspecies within Mycobacterium abscessus: Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. abscessus and Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. massiliense. The proposal of Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. massiliense is not in accordance with the Rules of the Bacteriological Code, because the epithet bolletii has priority over the epithet massiliense. Consequently, the name Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. massiliense is illegitimate. In 2011, Leao et al. validly publish the correct name ¤ Mycobacterium abscessus subsp. bolletii (Adékambi et al. 2006) Leao et al. 2011.

      

    "Mycobacterium alsiense" Richter et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: RICHTER (E.), TORTOLI (E.), FISCHER (A.), HENDRICKS (O.), ENGEL (R.), HILLEMANN (D.), SCHUBERT (S.) and KRISTIANSEN (J.E.): Mycobacterium alsiense, a novel, slowly growing species isolated from two patients with pulmonary disease. J. Clin. Microbiol, 2007, 45, 3837-3839. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium avium subsp.hominissuis" Mijs et al., subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: no type strain designated.
    Reference: MIJS (W.), de HAAS (P.), ROSSAU (R.), VAN DER LAAN (T.), RIGOUTS (L.), PORTAELS (F.) and van SOOLINGEN (D.): Molecular evidence to support a proposal to reserve the designation Mycobacterium avium subsp. avium for bird-type isolates and 'M. avium subsp. hominissuis' for the human/porcine type of M. avium. Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol., 2002, 52, 1505-1518. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium barrassiae" Adékambi et al., sp. nov.

    Reference: ADÉKAMBI (T.), RAOULT (D.) and DRANCOURT (M.): Mycobacterium barrassiae sp. nov., a Mycobacterium moriokaense group species associated with chronic pneumonia. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2006, 44, 3493-3498. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium canetti" van Soolingen et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: no type strain designated.
    Reference: VAN SOOLINGEN (D.), HOOGENBOEZEM (T.), DE HAAS (P.E.W.), HERMANS (P.W.M.), KOEDAM (M.A.), TEPPEMA (K.S.), BRENNAN (P.J.), BESRA (G.S.), PORTAELS (F.), TOP (J.), SCHOULS (L.M.) and VAN EMBDEN (J.D.A.): A novel pathogenic taxon of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex, Canetti: characterization of an exceptional isolate from Africa. Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol, 1997, 47, 1236-1245.
    Notes:

  • The authors also suggest the name "Mycobacterium tuberculosis subsp. canetti".
  • In several articles, this taxon is also cited as "Mycobacterium canettii". Of course, "Mycobacterium canettii" (named in honour of Georges Canetti) is more correct than "Mycobacterium canetti".
  • In several articles, this taxon is not written in quotes.

      

    "Mycobacterium chesapeaki" Heckert et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain RH2000.
    Reference: HECKERT (R.A.), ELANKUMARAN (S.), MILANI (A.) and BAYA (A.): Detection of a new Mycobacterium species in wild striped bass in the Chesapeake Bay. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2001, 39, 710-715. Effective publication Online

Emerg. Infect. Dis., 2011, 17, 1692-1700. Effective publication Online

    Reference: HONG (T.), BUTLER (W.R.), HOLLIS (F.), FLOYD (M.M.), TONEY (S.R.), TANG (Y.W.), STEELE (C.) and LEGGIADRO (R.J.): Characterization of a novel rapidly growing Mycobacterium species associated with sepsis. J. Clin. Microbiol., 2003, 41, 5650-5653. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium hippocampi" Balcázar et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain BFLP-6 = DSM 45391 = LMG 25372.
    Reference: BALCÁZAR (J.L.), PLANAS (M.) and PINTADO (J.): Novel Mycobacterium species in seahorses with tail rot. Emerg. Infect. Dis. 2011, 17, 1770-1773. Effective publication Online

    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: HAN (X.Y.), SEO (Y.H.), SIZER (K.C.), SCHOBERLE (T.), MAY (G.S.), SPENCER (J.S.), LI (W.) and NAIR (R.G.): a new Mycobacterium species causing diffuse lepromatous leprosy. Am. J. Clin. Pathol., 2008, 130, 856-864. Effective publication Online

    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: ALEXANDER (K.A.), LAVER (P.N.), MICHEL (A.L.), WILLIAMS (M.), VAN HELDEN (P.D.), WARREN (R.M.) and GEY VAN PITTIUS (N.C.): Novel Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex pathogen, M. mungi. Emerg. Infect. Dis. 2010, 16, 1296-1299. Effective publication Online

Microbiol. Immunol., 2010, 54, 46-53.

    Proposed type strain: strain SD4.

J. Clin. Microbiol., 2004, 42, 52-59. Effective publication Online
    Note: "Mycobacterium sherrisii" Selvarangan et al. is now known as ¤ Mycobacterium sherrisii van Ingen et al. 2011.

      

    "Mycobacterium shigaense" Nakanaga et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .
    Reference: NAKANAGA (K.), HOSHINO (Y.), WAKABAYASHI (M.), FUJIMOTO (N.), TORTOLI (E.), MAKINO (M.), TANAKA (T.) and ISHII (N.): Mycobacterium shigaense sp. nov., a novel slowly growing scotochromogenic mycobacterium that produced nodules in an erythroderma patient with severe cellular immunodeficiency and a history of Hodgkin's disease. J. Dermatol., 2012, 39, 389-396. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium sinense" Zhang et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain JDM601.
    Reference: ZHANG (Z.Y.), SUN (Z.Q.), WANG (Z.L.), HU (H.R.), WEN (Z.L.), SONG (Y.Z.), ZHAO (J.W.), WANG (H.H.), GUO (X.K.) and ZHANG (S.L.): Identification and pathogenicity analysis of a novel non-tuberculous mycobacterium clinical isolate with nine-antibiotic resistance. Clin. Microbiol. Infect., 2013, 19, 91-96. Effective publication Online

      

    "Mycobacterium tuberculosis subsp. canetti" van Soolingen et al., subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: no type strain designated.
    Reference: VAN SOOLINGEN (D.), HOOGENBOEZEM (T.), DE HAAS (P.E.W.), HERMANS (P.W.M.), KOEDAM (M.A.), TEPPEMA (K.S.), BRENNAN (P.J.), BESRA (G.S.), PORTAELS (F.), TOP (J.), SCHOULS (L.M.) and VAN EMBDEN (J.D.A.): A novel pathogenic taxon of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex, Canetti: characterization of an exceptional isolate from Africa. Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol, 1997, 47, 1236-1245.
    Notes:

  • The authors also suggest the name "Mycobacterium canetti".
  • In several articles, this taxon is also cited as "Mycobacterium tuberculosis subsp. canettii". Of course, "Mycobacterium tuberculosis subsp. canettii" (named in honour of Caneti) is more correct than "Mycobacterium tuberculosis subsp. canetti".
  • In several articles, this taxon is not written in quotes.

    Proposed type strain: The type strain I17P1(T) has been deposited with the Mollicutes Collection at Purdue University and with the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC BAA-1435) in the USA. A limited number of cultures generated by the authors have also been deposited with the Culture Collection, University of Göteborg, in Sweden (CCUG 53461).

    "Prescottella equi" (Magnusson 1923) Jones  et al., comb. nov.
    Proposed type strain: C 7 = ATCC 25729= ATCC 6939= CCUG 892 = CIP 54.72 = DSM 20307 = HAMBI 2061 = JCM 1311 = JCM 3209 = LMG 18452 = NBRC 101255 = NCTC 1621 = NRRL B-16538 = VKM Ac-953.
    Basonym: Corynebacterium equi Magnusson 1923 (Approved Lists 1980).
    Another homotypic synonym: Rhodococcus equi (Magnusson 1923) Goodfellow and Alderson 1977 (Approved Lists 1980).
    Reference: JONES (A.L.), SUTCLIFFE (I.C.) and GOODFELLOW (M.): Proposal to replace the illegitimate genus name Prescottia Jones et al. 2013 with the genus name Prescottella gen. nov. and to replace the illegitimate combination Prescottia equi Jones et al. 2013 with Prescottella equi comb. nov.     Proposed type strain: C 7 = ATCC 25729= ATCC 6939= CCUG 892 = CIP 54.72 = DSM 20307 = HAMBI 2061 = NBRC 14956 = JCM 1311 = JCM 3209 = LMG 18452 = NBRC 101255 = NCTC 1621 = NRRL B-16538 = VKM Ac-953.

    "Psychrosinus fermentans" Sattley et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain FCF9.
    Reference: SATTLEY (W.M.), JUNG (D.O.) and MADIGAN (M.T.): Psychrosinus fermentans gen. nov., sp. nov., a lactate-fermenting bacterium from near-freezing oxycline waters of a meromictic Antarctic lake. FEMS Microbiol. Lett., 2008, 287, 121-127. Effective publication Online

      

    "Pyrococcus abyssi" Erauso et al. (complete authorship reads Erauso, Reysenbach, Pace and Prieur), sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain GE5 = CNCM I-1302.
    Reference: ERAUSO (G.), REYSENBACH (A.L.), GODFROY (A.), MEUNIER (J.R.), CRUMP (B.), PARTENSKY (F.), BAROSS (J.A.), MARTEINSSON (V.), BARBIER (G.), PACE (N.R.) and PRIEUR (D.): Pyrococcus abyssi sp. nov., a new hyperthermophilic archaeon isolated from a deep-sea hydrothermal vent. Arch. Microbiol., 1993, 160, 338-349.

      

    "Pyrococcus kodakaraensis" Rahman et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain KDO1.
    Reference: RAHMAN (R.N.), FUJIWARA (S.), NAKAMURA (H.), TAKAGI (M.) and IMANAKA (T.): Ion pairs involved in maintaining a thermostable structure of glutamate dehydrogenase from a hyperthermophilic archaeon. Biochem. Biophys. Res. Commun. 1998, 248, 920-9266.
    Notes:

  • Pyrococcus kodakaraensis was formerly named Pyrococcus sp. KOD1 Morikawa et al. 1994 (see, Morikawa et al.: Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 1994, 60, 4559-4566).
  • Pyrococcus kodakaraensis is also known as Thermococcus kodakaraensis.

    Proposed type species: "Pyxicoccus fallax" Reichenbach.
    Reference: REICHENBACH (H.): Genus III. Pyxicoccus gen. nov. In: D.J. BRENNER, N.R. KRIEG, J.T. STALEY and G. M. GARRITY (editors), Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology, second edition, vol. 2 (The Proteobacteria), part C (The Alpha-, Beta-, Delta-, and Epsilonproteobacteria), Springer, New York, 2005, pp. 1083-1084.
    Note: "Pyxicoccus" is now known as ¤ Pyxidicoccus corrig. Reichenbach 2007.

    "Sarraceniospora aurea" Tamura and Hatano, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain .

    "Schleiferella" Rajendram et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Schleiferella asaccharolytica" (Distaso 1912) Rajendram et al.
    Reference: RAJENDRAM (D.), SHAH (H.N.), GHARBIA (S.E.) and MURDOCH (D.A.): Reclassification of Peptostreptococcus asaccharolyticus (Distaso 1912) Ezaki, Yamamoto, Ninomiya, Suzuki and Yabuuchi 1983 as Schleiferella asaccharolytica comb. nov., Peptostreptococcus indolicus (Christiansen 1934) Ezaki, Yamamoto, Ninomiya, Suzuki and Yabuuchi 1983 as Schleiferella indolica comb. nov., Peptostreptococcus lacrimalis Li, Hashimoto, Adnan, Miura, Yamamoto and Ezaki 1992 as Schleiferella lacrimalis comb. nov. and Peptostreptococcus harei (Murdoch, Collins, Willems, Hardie, Young and Magee 1997) as Schleiferella harei comb. nov. Anaerobe, 2001, 7, 93-101.

      

    "Schleiferella asaccharolytica" (Distaso 1912) Rajendram et al., comb. nov.
    Proposed type strain: ATCC 14963= CCUG 9988 = CIP 74.17 = DSM 20463 = NCTC 11461.
    Proposed basonym: Peptococcus asaccharolyticus (Distaso 1912) Douglas 1957 (Approved Lists 1980).
    Other synonyms: Peptostreptococcus asaccharolyticus (Distaso 1912) Ezaki et al. 1983, "Staphylococcus asaccharolyticus" Distaso 1912, "Micrococcus asaccharolyticus" (Distaso 1912) Hall 1948.

Anaerobe, 2001, 7, 93-101.

    "Vibrio aestuarianus subsp. aestuarianus" Tison and Seidler 1983, subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain OY-0-002 = ATCC 35048= CAIM 592 = CCUG 28583 = CIP 102971 = NBRC 15629 = LMG 7909.
    Reference: GARNIER (M.), LABREUCHE (Y.) and NICOLAS (J.L.): Molecular and phenotypic characterization of Vibrio aestuarianus subsp. francensis subsp. nov., a pathogen of the oyster Crassostrea gigas. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2008, 31, 358-365. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio aestuarianus subsp. francensis" Garnier et al., subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain 02/041 = LMG 24517 = CIP 109791.
    Reference: GARNIER (M.), LABREUCHE (Y.) and NICOLAS (J.L.): Molecular and phenotypic characterization of Vibrio aestuarianus subsp. francensis subsp. nov., a pathogen of the oyster Crassostrea gigas. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2008, 31, 358-365. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio inhibens" Balcázar et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain BFLP-10 = CECT 7692 = DSM 23440.
    Reference: BALCÁZAR (J.L.), PLANAS (M.) and PINTADO (J.): Vibrio inhibens sp. nov., a novel bacterium with inhibitory activity against Vibrio species. J. Antibiot. (Tokyo), 2012, 65, 301-305. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio neocaledonicus" Chalkiadakis et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain NC470.
    Reference: CHALKIADAKIS (E.), DUFOURCQ (R.), SCHMITT (S.), BRANDIL (Y.C.), KERVAREC (N.), COATANEA (D.), AMIR (H.), LOUBERSAC (L.), CHANTEAU (S.), GUEZENNEC (J.), DUPONT-ROUZEYROL (M.) and SIMON-COLIN (C.): Partial characterization of an exopolysaccharide secreted by a marine bacterium, Vibrio neocaledonicus sp. nov., from New Caledonia. J. Appl. Microbiol., 2013, 114, 1702-1712. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio pommerensis" Jores et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain CH-291.
    Reference: JORES (J.), STEPHAN (R.), KNABNER (D.), GELDERBLOM (H.R.) and LEWIN (A.): Isolation of Vibrio vulnificus and atypical Vibrio from surface water of the Baltic Sea in Germany. Berlin. Münch. Tierärztl. Wochenschr., 2003, 116, 396-400.

      

    "Vibrio qinghaiensis" Ma et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain Q67.
    Reference: MA (M.), TONG (Z.), WANG (Z.) and ZHU (W.): Acute toxicity bioassay using the freshwater luminescent bacterium Vibrio-qinghaiensis sp. Nov.-Q67. Bull. Environ. Contam. Toxicol., 1999, 62, 247-253. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio zhanjiangensis" Jin et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain E414 = CCTCC AB 2011110 = NBRC 108723 = DSM 24901.
    Reference: JIN (C.), LUO (P.), ZUO (H.), CHEN (J.), CHEN (M.) and WANG (W): Vibrio zhanjiangensis sp. nov., isolated from sea water of shrimp farming pond. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2012, 101, 743-751. Effective publication Online

      

    "Vibrio zhuhaiensis" Jin et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain E20121 = DSM 25602 = CCTCC AB 2011174.
    Reference: JIN (C.), LUO (P.), ZUO (H.), CHEN (J.), CHEN (M.) and WANG (W.): Vibrio zhuhaiensis sp. nov., isolated from a Japanese prawn (Marsupenaeus japonicus). Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2013, 103, 989-996. Effective publication Online

      

    "Virgibacillus natechei" Amziane et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain FarD = DSM 25609 = CCUG 62224.
    Reference: AMZIANE (M.), METIAZ (F.), DARENFED-BOUANANE (A.), DJENANE (Z.), SELAMA (O.), ABDERRAHMANI (A.), CAYOL (J.L.) and FARDEAU (M.L.): Virgibacillus natechei sp. nov., a moderately halophilic bacterium isolated from sediment of a saline lake in Southwest of Algeria. Curr. Microbiol., 2013, 66, 462-466.  Effective publication Online

      

    "Virgibacillus zhanjiangensis" Peng et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain JSM 079157 = DSM 21084 = KCTC 13227.
    Reference: PENG (Q.Z.), CHEN (J.), ZHANG (Y.Q.), CHEN (Q.H.), PENG (D.J.), CUI (X.L.), LI (W.J.) and CHEN (Y.G.): Virgibacillus zhanjiangensis sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from sea water. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2009, 96, 645-652. Effective publication Online

      

    "Wangella" Jia et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Wangella harbinensis" Jia et al.
    Reference: JIA (F.), LIU (C.), WANG (X.), ZHAO (J.), LIU (Q.), ZHANG (J.), GAO (R.) and XIANG (W.): Wangella harbinensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Micromonosporaceae. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2013, 103, 399-408. Effective publication Online

      

    "Wangella harbinensis" Jia et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain NEAU-J3 = CGMCC 4.7039 = DSM 45747.
    Reference: JIA (F.), LIU (C.), WANG (X.), ZHAO (J.), LIU (Q.), ZHANG (J.), GAO (R.) and XIANG (W.): Wangella harbinensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Micromonosporaceae. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, 2013, 103, 399-408. Effective publication Online

      

    "Wangia" Qin et al., gen. nov.
    Proposed type species: "Wangia profunda" Qin et al.
    Reference: QIN (Q.L.), ZHAO (D.L.), WANG (J.), CHEN (X.L.), DANG (H.Y.), LI (T.G.), ZHANG (Y.Z.) and GAO (P.J.): Wangia profunda gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from southern Okinawa Trough deep-sea sediment. FEMS Microbiol. Lett., 2007, 271, 53-58. Effective publication Online
    Note: "Wangia" Qin et al. is now know as ¤ Zunongwangia corrig. Qin et al. 2007.

      

    "Wangia profunda" Qin et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain SM-A87 = CCTCC AB 206139 = DSM 18752.
    Reference: QIN (Q.L.), ZHAO (D.L.), WANG (J.), CHEN (X.L.), DANG (H.Y.), LI (T.G.), ZHANG (Y.Z.) and GAO (P.J.): Wangia profunda gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from southern Okinawa Trough deep-sea sediment. FEMS Microbiol. Lett., 2007, 271, 53-58. Effective publication Online
    Note: "Wangia profunda" Qin et al. is now known as ¤ Zunongwangia profunda corrig. Qin et al. 2007.

      

    "Winogradskyella jejuensis" Kim and Oh, sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain CP32 = KCTC 23835 = JCM 18454.
    Reference: KIM (J.Y.) and OH (D.C.): Winogradskyella jejuensis sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from a brown alga Carpopeltis affinis. J. Microbiol., 2012, 50, 888-892. Effective publication Online

      

    "Xanthobacter polyaromaticivorans" Hirano et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain 127W.
    Reference: HIRANO (S.), KITAUCHI (F.), HARUKI (M.), IMANAKA (T.), MORIKAWA (M.) and KANAYA (S.): Isolation and characterization of Xanthobacter polyaromaticivorans sp. nov. 127w that degrades polycyclic and heterocyclic aromatic compounds under extremely low oxygen conditions. Biosci. Biotechnol. Biochem., 2004, 68, 557-564.

      

    "Xanthomonas lactamgena" Ono et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain YK-278.
    Reference: ONO (H.), NOZAKI (Y.), KATAYAMA (N.) and OKAZAKI (H.): Cephabacins, new cephem antibiotics of bacterial origin. I. Discovery and taxonomy of the producing organisms and fermentation. J. Antibiot. (Tokyo), 1984, 37, 1528-1535.

      

    "Xylella fastidiosa subsp. pauca" Schaad et al. 2004, subsp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain ICPB 50031 = ICPM 15198.
    References:
    1 SCHAAD (N.W.), POSTNIKOVA (E.), LACY (G.), FATMI (M.) and CHANG (C.J.): Xylella fastidiosa subspecies: X. fastidiosa subsp fastidiosa, subsp. nov., X. fastidiosa subsp. multiplex subsp. nov., and X. fastidiosa subsp. pauca subsp. nov. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2004, 27, 290-300.
    2 Erratum. Syst. Appl. Microbiol., 2004, 27, 763. Effective publication Online - Erratum Online

      

    "Zetaproteobacteria" Emerson et al., class. nov.
    Proposed type order: "Mariprofundales" Emerson et al.
    Reference: EMERSON (D.), RENTZ (J.A.), LILBURN (T.G.), DAVIS (R.E.), ALDRICH (H.), CHAN (C.) and MOYER (C.L.): A novel lineage of Proteobacteria involved in formation of marine Fe-oxidizing microbial mat communities. PLoS ONE, 2007, 2(8): e667. Effective publication Online
    Note: In the paper by Emerson et al., the class "Zetaproteobacteria" is also cited as "Candidatus ζ-Proteobacteria".

      

    "Zooshikella rubidus" Lee et al., sp. nov.
    Proposed type strain: strain S1-1 = KCTC 11448BP.
    Reference: LEE (J.S., KIM (Y.S.), PARK (S.), KIM (J.), KANG (S.J.), LEE (M.H.), RYU (S.), CHOI (J.M.), OH (T.K.) and YOON (J.H.): A novel marine bacterial species Zooshikella rubidus S1-1 produces exceptionally both of prodigiosin and cycloprodigiosin as major metabolic constituents. Appl. Environ. Microbiol., 2011, 77, 4967-4973. Effective publication Online

      

    *: Effective publication

     

    - Publication of the name and description of a taxon in a recognized scientific printed and/or electronic material publication [Rule 23a Note 5 and Rule 25a]. The publications must be conform to requirements laid down in the Bacteriological Code (1990 Revision).

    - No other kind of publication (communications at meetings, minutes of meetings, abstracts of papers presented at meetings, catalogues of collections, microfilms, nonscientific periodicals, newsletters, patents...) is accepted as effective [Rule 25b].

    - When a name of a new taxon is published in a work written in a language unfamiliar to the majority of workers in bacteriology, it is recommended that the author(s) include in the effective publication a description in English [Rule 25a].

    - Date of effective publication does not determine priority [Rules 23b and 27].
    Example: Haemophilus felis was effectively published in 1992 (J. Clin. Microbiol., 1992, 30, 2108-2112.) but validly published in 1999 (Validation List no. 69: Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol., 1999, 49, 341-342). The date of this name is 1999.

    - When proposed in full articles in the International Journal of Systematic Bacteriology or in the International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology the publications are automatically effective and valid publications [Rule 27]. However, the publications must be conform to requirements laid down in the Bacteriological Code (1990 Revision).
